physical_appearance:This is a white kebaya decorated with embroideries of flowers down the front
 amongst other smaller foliage patterns. The fabric has pink and green dot details. The kebaya has elongated tapered ends.
subject_terms_1:folk costume flowers (motifs) Peranakan tops (garments
 general) blouses (main garments)
subject_terms_2:Ethnic costume Motifs Peranakan (Asian people) Blouses
subject_terms_3:Peranakan costumes
sgcool_label_text:This kebaya is decorated with sprays of flowers both down the front and behind. Accents of smaller blooms adorn the edges. The fabric is stippled with salmon pink and green dots. Kebayas with elongated tapered ends were popular in the 1930s and many were commissioned by Peranakan women. It is part of a donation which contains a mixture of garments worn by Peranakan men and women.
